NURSERY AND KIDS BEDROOM DRESSER: Universal design to match any nursery or kids bedroom; 6 drawer bedroom dresser; Crafted of wood composites, laminated with a durable, easy-to-clean PU coated surface, and includes Euro drawer glides; Assembly required

SAFETY TESTED: Tested to meet or exceed applicable CPSIA & ASTM International category safety standards including ASTM F2057 safety specification for clothing storage units, intended to reduce furniture tip-over hazards to children aged 5 & under

body.description: The Storkcraft Alpine 6 Drawer Dresser offers a versatile combination of timeless design and spacious storage. Featuring 6 spacious drawers and available in 4 high quality laminate finishes (White, Gray, Black, or Espresso), the Alpine Dresser was designed to match seamlessly with any room in your home – from nursery to children’s room, and guest bedroom to playroom. Like all Storkcraft dressers and chests, the Alpine 6 Drawer Dresser is meticulously tested to meet or exceed all applicable federal safety standards to ensure the safest environment for your child. It’s important we focus on all the details, so you can focus on the family moments. For extra storage or to fit a smaller space, this 6 drawer dresser is also available in a conveniently sized matching 4 drawer dresser.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Storkcraft Alpine 6 Drawer Double Dresser Spacious storage. Classic details. Easy-to-match, universal design. Bring your dream nursery or children's bedroom to life with the Alpine. The Storkcraft Alpine 6 Drawer Double Dresser is a modern, universal nursery and kids bedroom dresser that’s designed to match seamlessly with any nursery or kids room. The Alpine's 6 spacious drawers are perfect for storing and organizing your nursery essentials and kids bedroom items. Plus, the Alpine's classic design is accentuated by its charming wooden drawer knobs. The Alpine is crafted of wood composites, laminated with a durable, easy-to-clean PU coated surface, and includes Euro drawer glides. Universal design: The Alpine was designed to match easily with any style of nursery or children’s bedroom furniture and décorExpert tested: Like all Storkcraft chests and dressers, the Alpine is expert tested by independent third-party laboratories to meet or exceed all applicable category voluntary and mandatory safety standardsTested for safety: Like all Storkcraft chests and dressers, the Alpine is tested to meet or exceed ASTM International’s industry standard ASTM F2057 safety specification for clothing storage units, which is intended to reduce furniture tip-over hazards to children aged five and underPackaged with care: All Storkcraft packaging is tested and certified to reduce the risk of incidental damage that could occur during shipment

Awards & Certificates Exclusively from Storkcraft — Since 1945 Exclusively from Storkcraft — over 75 years of bringing dream nurseries and children's bedrooms to life (since 1945). Proud recipient of the PTPA Seal of Approval Proud recipient of the Parent Tested Parent Approved (PTPA) Seal of Approval — the leader in consumer product awards for families, based on the unbiased and authentic testing from North America's largest parent testing community. Women's Choice Award Winner Storkcraft is the proud recipient of the 2022 Women's Choice Award for 9 out of 10 Customer Recommended Baby & Kids Furniture, as voted by mothers across America.

Storage. Versatility. Easy-to-match style Complete nursery and children's bedroom functionality 6 spacious drawers to store nursery and kids bedroom essentials, and available in multiple colors. Durable, easy-to-clean PU coated surface Crafted of wood composites, laminated with a durable, easy-to-clean PU coated surface, and includes Euro drawer glides. Expert tested for safety All Storkcraft chests and dressers are expert tested by independent third-party laboratories to meet or exceed all applicable category voluntary and mandatory safety standards. All Storkcraft chests and dressers are tested to meet or exceed ASTM International’s industry standard ASTM F2057 safety specification for clothing storage units, which is intended to reduce furniture tip-over hazards to children aged five and under.

Bring your dream nursery or children's bedroom to life with the Storkcraft Alpine — available in multiple colors White The Storkcraft Alpine 6 Drawer Dresser is available in a crisp and timeless white coated surface. Pebble Gray The Storkcraft Alpine 6 Drawer Dresser is available in a versatile pebble gray coated surface. Gray The Storkcraft Alpine 6 Drawer Dresser is available in a cool gray coated surface.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 29, 2023
reviews.reviewText: It’s a very nice piece of furniture. I’m 35 weeks pregnant and I put it together in a little over 5 hours (while watching the last season of Crown on Netflix lol). The instructions might seem a little confusing if you never did anything like this before. It would be much easier to use some extra help. The top fits any standard changing pad just fine. I’m very satisfied and the price was just right. The color is also beautiful. I do recommend it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great for nursery
reviews.reviewText: It was a lot of pieces but overall very well packaged, and very clear and detailed instructions. It took about 3 hours to out together but feels very sturdy.We are planning to use in a nursery and swapped out the original hardware for something more chic

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 31, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Took me 5 hours to assemble; be prepared for that! But otherwise it's nice
reviews.reviewText: The price was good, the color is true to the picture and it seems sturdy enough. But it comes completely in pieces, and will take you a long time to put together and you need to be prepared for that. The directions aren't the best but they aren't the worst either, just take your time and step by step... I just watched youtube videos on my phone while I put it together but again - took me 5 hours. I am also 8.5 months pregnant so that also may have slowed me down, but I am pretty sure it still would have taken me a long time to put together. I did it by myself but I have a feeling if I did it with my husband it may have caused an argument from frustration or misunderstanding of the directions LOL so I would try to assemble yourself or tell yourself to be very patient with your "helper" who would be helping you assemble it lol.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 6, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect changing tabler/drawers!
reviews.reviewText: I got this for my baby that's due this month. It matches my crib perfectly and looks so nice! There's a lot of drawer space and I love the display shelves! My husband didn't have a very hard time putting it together, though it was a lot of piecing things together! It's sturdy and beautiful! I'm very happy with my purchase! It will be perfect for my little one and everything we need to store for her ☺️

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 9, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars MUST READ REVIEW
reviews.reviewText: After reading some of the reviews on here I was hesitant to purchase this dresser. After purchasing it, here I my thoughts. Ignore the people who said it took them anywhere over 2 hours to build this. I’m currently 22 weeks pregnant and I put this whole thing together during my toddlers 2 hour nap. It’s made of coated particle board which is my only disappointment but it is completely solid when put together properly.It came packaged compactly so there was absolutely no room for pieces to rub together and with lots of wrapping to protect the parts.When I opened the box I laid all the pieces that matched together. All the pieces labeled A with all the other A pieces. All the pieces labeled B with all the other B pieces. You get the point. A drill on a low torque setting will be your best friend in this too. They have a YouTube video you and can watch so if you get confused on which direction something goes. It will clear it up.You would literally have to have absolutely no skill at putting a screw or peg in a hole to need more than 2 hours to build this. That’s the nicest way I can put that.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 28, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Pile of Junk
reviews.reviewText: Worst $230 I’ve ever spent. I bought it for my 10 month old sons room. First of all, It took me almost an entire day to put it together. Yes I was taking breaks during assembly but that’s because it wasn’t simple enough for me to sit and put it together while taking care of my son all in one go. I only had it in his room 2 months before it fell apart. It almost fell apart pushing it on furniture sliders from the kitchen to his room the night I assembled it.We eventually decided it wasn’t worth the hassle and purchased an already assembled dresser from a furniture store local to us. It continued to fall apart while we were moving it from his room to the garage.At first I planned to sell it for a cheap price, but then realized I couldn’t sell it because it was literally falling apart. I’ve said that several times now, but I just want to emphasize that. IT WAS FALLING APART.We decided to just put it out on our curb for bulk trash pick up to haul it away and eat the money. Well, as we were moving it from the garage to the curb, it literally crumbled to the ground. We were able to put it in TRASH BAGS. That’s how many pieces this stupid thing was in. Mind you, we knew it was in bad shape so we put it on a dolly and wheeled it to the curb so it’s not like we were dragging it, or even carrying it despite it being extremely light.I am so upset at this purchase. It was an expensive lesson learned to never buy furniture on Amazon. Not worth the hassle or the risk.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 7, 2024
reviews.reviewText: The media could not be loaded. We purchased a Storkcraft dresser in 2021 and expected the same quality. Immediately into putting this model together we had issues. A Camlock was broken, there was a spilt in the top we didn’t see until we took it out of the box to put on, and the top drawer is uneven and does not open or close without force. I tried every single drawer and had the same issue. Which makes the top drawer unusable for my toddler. This looks to be a very sturdy nice dresser but the many issues make me regret spending so much on it for the quality.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 28, 2024
reviews.reviewText: The instructions were super clear, It took a long time ( 6 hours) but i did it all alone. Amazing and great for a nursery or regular home decor!
Easy to set up,looks great and good quality.
Took a long time to assemble and the instructions are not as clear as IKEA instructions. Feels very lightweight and the drawers might break easily. We will see with time.

Very pleased with this dresser - perfect size for toddler wardrobe with room to spare. Can’t speak to durability at this point but has survived quite a few bumps. The finish has been easy to clean. Fits a change pad. Knobs easily removable. The white is not stark nor creamy - adapts well to any decor. Assembly was ok with 2 - took almost 3hours. Marginally better quality than IKEA dresser.

reviews.reviewTitle: Terrible... save your time and money..
reviews.reviewText: My wife and I purchased this a few months ahead of our daughter being born (thankfully we did). This dresser arrived covered in black dirt or something along those lines. Once everything was cleaned I was ready to assemble the dresser only to get 3/4 of the way through and realize it was missing parts... The process of contacting the company to get the parts took nearly 3 weeks of back and fourth emails and pictures of the dresser with specific labels the company had stuck within the dresser drawers. Once we finally had the parts I was able to fully assemble it only to notice another issue... The dressers legs are 1/4 inch or so shorter on the front so it now leans forward becoming a tipping hazard. Overall this product is a complete joke and should not be market towards kids as it lacks basic safety standers (could tip onto your child if not bolted to the wall).

reviews.reviewTitle: Simply frustrating... won't buy from this brand ever again!
reviews.reviewText: It's the second product I bought from this brand and it's the second time that the product came with multiple broken parts and very poor finishing. Please Storkcaft, get your act together and show some respect for your customers!!
